bug.author: T3hlo
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.14 Python version: 3.7.4 Operating System: Linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
When running wandb.init in a jupyter notebook, which previously worked wandb crashes with the following error: <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>wandb.init(project='project_name', entity='user_name', tags=[some tags], reinit=True, )
Error: --------------------------------------------------------------------------- GitCommandError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-8-686df0be329d> in <module> 1 save_name = '3.1.1' ----> 2 wandb.init(project='3.1', entity='treich', tags=[save_name, 'GRU', 'MinFeatures', '1-stack'],reinit=True, ) 3 4 5 model = GRU_rolling(input_size=12, hidden_size=64, layer_number=1,
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py in init(job_type, dir, config, project, entity, reinit, tags, group, allow_val_change, resume, force, tensorboard, sync_tensorboard, monitor_gym, name, notes, id, magic, anonymous) 1068 allow_val_change = True 1069 if config or telemetry_updated: -> 1070 run.config._update(config, allow_val_change=allow_val_change, as_defaults=not allow_val_change) 1071 1072 # Access history to ensure resumed is set when resuming
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/wandb_config.py in _update(self, params, allow_val_change, as_defaults) 276 continue 277 self._items[key] = val --> 278 self.persist() 279 280 def update(self, params, allow_val_change=False):
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/wandb_config.py in persist(self) 194 conf_file.write(str(self)) 195 if wandb.run and wandb.run._jupyter_agent: --> 196 wandb.run._jupyter_agent.start() 197 198 def get(self, *args):
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/jupyter.py in start(self) 120 def start(self): 121 if self.paused: --> 122 self.rm = RunManager(wandb.run, output=False, cloud=wandb.run.mode != "dryrun") 123 wandb.run.api._file_stream_api = None 124 self.rm.mirror_stdout_stderr()
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/run_manager.py in __init__(self, run, project, tags, cloud, output, port) 504 # Calling .start() on _meta and _system_stats will spin a thread that reports system stats every 30 seconds 505 self._system_stats = stats.SystemStats(run, self._api) --> 506 self._meta = meta.Meta(self._api, self._run.dir) 507 self._meta.data["jobType"] = self._run.job_type 508 self._meta.data["mode"] = self._run.mode
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/meta.py in __init__(self, api, out_dir) 34 self.data = {} 35 self.lock = threading.Lock() ---> 36 self.setup() 37 self._thread = threading.Thread(target=self._thread_body) 38 self._thread.daemon = True
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/meta.py in setup(self) 72 self.data["root"] = self._api.git.root or self.data["root"] 73 ---> 74 if os.path.exists(program) and self._api.git.is_untracked(self.data["program"]): 75 util.mkdir_exists_ok(os.path.join(self.out_dir, "code", os.path.dirname(self.data["program"]))) 76 saved_program = os.path.join(self.out_dir, "code", self.data["program"])
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/git_repo.py in is_untracked(self, file_name) 35 if not self.repo: 36 return True ---> 37 return file_name in self.repo.untracked_files 38 39 @property
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/git/repo/base.py in untracked_files(self) 673 This property is expensive, as no cache is involved. To process the result, please 674 consider caching it yourself.""" --> 675 return self._get_untracked_files() 676 677 def _get_untracked_files(self, *args, **kwargs):
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/git/repo/base.py in _get_untracked_files(self, *args, **kwargs) 699 filename = filename.decode('string_escape').decode(defenc) 700 untracked_files.append(filename) --> 701 finalize_process(proc) 702 return untracked_files 703
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/git/util.py in finalize_process(proc, **kwargs) 330 """Wait for the process (clone, fetch, pull or push) and handle its errors accordingly""" 331 ## TODO: No close proc-streams?? --> 332 proc.wait(**kwargs) 333 334
~/anaconda3/envs/p366/lib/python3.6/site-packages/git/cmd.py in wait(self, stderr) 412 errstr = read_all_from_possibly_closed_stream(self.proc.stderr) 413 log.debug('AutoInterrupt wait stderr: %r' % (errstr,)) --> 414 raise GitCommandError(self.args, status, errstr) 415 # END status handling 416 return status
GitCommandError: Cmd('git') failed due to: exit code(128) cmdline: git status --porcelain --untracked-files stderr: 'fatal: bad object HEAD </denchmark-code>

It seems to have been temporary
